item.title: Games That Should Have Won Game Of The Year
item.description:
Summary

  • Even though every GOTY winner definitely deserved it, every year had at least one other game that could have also received this prestigious award instead.
  • Excellent video games that almost won, like Uncharted 4 and Bayonetta 2, are still fondly remembered to this day.
  • Each runner-up, from Bloodborne to Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , remains a modern classic, regardless of their loss.

At the end of every year, gamers all around the world watch The Game Awards with one big question in mind: Which video game is going to win Game of the Year (aka GOTY)? Many great titles have received this prestigious award since its inception, which unfortunately means that a handful of beloved nominees had to lose it.

There are a lot of excellent video games that should have won Game of the Year, and these are some of the clearest examples. It’s important to clarify that the actual GOTY winners absolutely deserved to receive that award. It’s just that the following runner-ups are so good that they could have easily won it as well.

Bayonetta 2

Lost To Dragon Age: Inquisition In 2014

Bayonetta 2
8 /10
Released
October 24, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

While Dragon Age: Inquisition was a much-needed return to form for the Dragon Age franchise, and deserved its accolades, 2014 was a great year with many solid GOTY contenders. One of the best was Bayonetta 2 , the long-awaited sequel to PlatinumGames’ hack-and-slash masterpiece that Nintendo practically brought back from the dead.

Bayonetta 2 is an over-the-top adventure full of unbelievable action and excellent boss fights, topped with a complex but dynamic combat system. This is one of the games that encouraged people to buy a Wii U, as it made Nintendo’s console feel just as graphically powerful as its competition. Unfortunately, that might have also been the nail in Bayonetta 2 ’s coffin. It was a Wii U exclusive, which means that not many people got to try it. Fortunately, this has since changed, as the first two Bayonetta games are now available on Nintendo Switch.

Bloodborne

Lost To The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt In 2015

Bloodborne
22
9.1 /10
Released
March 24, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Powered by

There’s no denying that The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the greatest RPGs of the last decade, and it deserved to win Game of the Year in 2015. Still, nobody would have complained if Bloodborne won instead. Players praise this legendary game to this day, more than ten years after its initial release.

Bloodborne was From Software's first Soulslike game that had nothing to do with the Dark Souls IP. The game's bleak, creepy Lovecraftian atmosphere perfectly complemented its ruthless but satisfying combat system, which is even faster and more accessible than previous Soulslike games. Some version of this modern classic may receive this award someday if Sony and FromSoftware ever decide to make a Bloodborne remaster/remake — or better yet, a full-on sequel.

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End

Lost To Overwatch In 2016

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End
10 /10
13
9.2 /10
Released
May 10, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
Naughty Dog
Powered by

Overwatch ’s victory in 2016 is still considered one of the most controversial moments in the history of the Game Awards. Of course, Blizzard’s multiplayer FPS was really fun, and became a worldwide phenomenon, but many gamers would have preferred if a single-player adventure won instead. (This sentiment was further justified by Overwatch 1 ’s servers shutting down in 2021.)

Out of all the excellent single-player video games released in 2016, Uncharted 4: A Thief's End deserved to win GOTY the most. Not only was this the final game in this beloved series, but it was also the first game Naughty Dog made after The Last of Us. Uncharted 4 not only met those high expectations; it surpassed them. It's a thrilling cinematic adventure with incredible set pieces, beautiful environments, and a captivating narrative that closes off Nathan Drake’s story in a satisfying way.

Red Dead Redemption 2

Lost To God Of War In 2018

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
169
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Powered by

2018 was one of the closest years for the award. Gamers were wondering which legendary new game was going to be named GOTY: God of War or Red Dead Redemption 2 . Even though Kratos’ Nordic adventure ended up winning (and deserved it), Red Dead Redemption 2 ’s loss left a bad taste in many people’s mouths. This is Rockstar’s magnum opus, and is still considered one of the best open-world games ever made.

Despite coming out over eight years after its predecessor, this western-themed sandbox title surpassed all expectations by being the perfect cowboy simulator. The map is huge, and it’s full of fun stuff to do, not to mention that every NPC, animal, plant, and object is brimming with detail. But, of course, the narrative is the biggest highlight of Red Dead Redemption 2. Arthur Morgan’s perilous journey is engaging, intense, and emotional, and it sets the stage for John Marston’s story in Red Dead Redemption 1 .

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate

Lost To Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice In 2019

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
9 /10
18
8.9 /10
Released
December 7, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Cartoon Violence, Comic Mischief, Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Bandai Namco Entertainment
Platform(s)
Switch
Powered by

FromSoftware got its first GOTY victory in 2019, when the excellent Sekiro: Shadow Die Twice won the award. But, even though Sekiro is one of the studio’s best games, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate was another strong contender. This was the definitive Smash Bros . game that fans had been waiting to see for decades, and it didn’t disappoint.

Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is a perfect celebration of not only Nintendo, but the entire gaming industry. Iconic characters like Mario, Link, Pikachu, Sonic, Pac-Man, Mega Man, Solid Snake, Ryu, Ken, Cloud, Simon Belmont, and countless more face each other in a fun, chaotic, satisfying fighting game that gets even better with other people. Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is also brimming with stages, items, modes, bosses, etc. It has given Nintendo Switch users thousands of hours of enjoyment, and is still played by a lot of people on a regular basis.

Ghost of Tsushima

Lost To The Last Of Us Part 2 In 2020

Ghost of Tsushima
9 /10
43
8.9 /10
Released
July 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Partial Nudity
Developer(s)
Sucker Punch
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

2020 was a weird but important year for gaming. The COVID-19 pandemic forced people to stay at home, and many ended up playing more video games as a result. While that year’s GOTY, The Last of Us Part 2, is an excellent game with a dark and captivating storyline, a lot of gamers were not happy with its victory. 2020 also saw the release of many other high-quality single-player experiences.

Sony Interactive Entertainment was the biggest winner of the year, as The Last of Us Part 2 was not the only incredible PS4 exclusive it put out during that time. There was also Ghost of Tsushima , Sucker Punch’s excellent samurai-themed open-world game that pushed the console to its limits. With its breathtaking environments, an intriguing narrative inspired by classic samurai films, and a life-like combat system, Ghost of Tsushima was the biggest surprise of 2020. And it seems like its upcoming sequel, Ghost of Yotei , will be even better.

Metroid Dread

Lost To It Takes Two In 2021

Metroid Dread
8.5 /10
Released
October 8, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Animated Blood, Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
MercurySteam
Powered by

It Takes Two ’s victory was a much-needed breath of fresh air for followers of the Game Awards. It proved that not all GOTY winners had to be ambitious AAA projects, and that more experimental and smaller titles could win this prestigious award as well. Nevertheless, 2021 was still packed with great GOTY contenders. Metroid Dread would have likely received the award if It Takes Two hadn’t come out that year.

Metroid Dread was the unexpected comeback of a game that had allegedly been in development for almost twenty years, and the final version didn’t disappoint. Following the success of Metroid: Samus Returns , developer Mercury Steam built a fantastic 2.5D action-adventure platformer, complete with a massive map and some of the most epic boss fights in the franchise. But the most fascinating aspect of Metroid Dread was its multiple E.M.M.I segments, which turned the experience into a suspenseful stealth/horror game that never feels frustrating or obnoxious.

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

Lost To Baldur's Gate 3 In 2023

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
59
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Publisher(s)
Nintendo
Powered by

2023 was one of those incredible years in which people had no idea which game was going to win GOTY. There were strong contenders, like Alan Wake 2 , Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , Resident Evil 4 Remake , and Baldur's Gate 3 . Larian Studios’ magnum opus was the winner of the night, but The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom could have easily won as well.

After waiting six long years, Legend of Zelda fans finally received a full sequel to Breath of the Wild (which won GOTY in 2017) and it was even better than its predecessor. Tears of the Kingdom told a brilliant time-travel story that introduced fans to the best incarnation of the iconic villain Ganondorf. It had a massive open world with three different layers, and it finally brought back the classic Zelda dungeon formula. However, this game especially stood out due to its ambitious and innovative Ultrahand mechanic, which allowed players to mix and match objects to build any vehicle and machine they could think of.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone Players Can Get a Free Operator Skin, But There's a Catch
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone players can claim a brand-new Monster Energy skin for free, simply by creating an account on the official Call of Duty x Monster Energy website. The latest Operator Skin for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone comes as part of Activision's collaboration with the popular drink brand, which will continue into Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 later this year with even more rewards up for grabs.

With Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 just two months away, Activision has confirmed that it will once again be teaming up with Monster Energy for plenty of new Call of Duty rewards. Earlier this week, the drink brand revealed the full list of rewards for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 on its website. New weapon blueprints, operator skins, double XP tokens, and more can be obtained via codes attached to Monster Energy cans. These codes can then be redeemed on the official Call of Duty x Monster Energy website and turned into rewards, which will then be available in-game on November 14.

Call of Duty Players Can Get a Free Monster Skin

As part of the continued collaboration between Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Monster Energy, players can now get their hands on another new Monster-themed skin for free. However, to obtain the skin for use in Black Ops 6 and Warzone , players need to visit the official Call of Duty x Monster Energy website, scroll down to the bottom and click the "register/login" button. For those who don't already have an account, simply fill in the form and link it with your Activision account to unlock the skin in-game. The account must be created before October 31, 2025, to unlock the reward.

Unfortunately, the new Monster Energy skin won't carry forward to Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 , as Activision recently walked back the feature after a huge amount of backlash from players. When the shooter was first revealed earlier this year, Activision confirmed that all operator skins, weapon blueprints, double XP tokens, Gobblegums, and more would automatically transfer from Black Ops 6 to Black Ops 7 with the game's first season. However, after fans protested the decision due to the large number of unrealistic cosmetic items in Black Ops 6 , the studio announced that only double XP tokens and Gobblegums would carry forward.

The decision to ditch Carry Forward for Black Ops 7 drew a mixed response from the game's community. On one hand, many players seemed to be pleased that unrealistic skins, such as Beavis & Butt-Head , won't be running around in Black Ops 7 lobbies. Other players, however, believe this is an anti-consumer move that gives players less choice in the next game. After spending money on store bundles and Battle Passes, some players are upset that they will no longer be able to make use of their purchases when Black Ops 7 rolls around on November 14.

item.title: Rainbow Six Siege Releases New Update for September 2025
item.description:
Rainbow Six Siege X recently released the Operation High Stakes update and added a slew of new features to the game, from a brand-new operator to overhauled maps. This is the third seasonal content refresh delivered by Rainbow Six Siege X 's developer, Ubisoft Montreal, in 2025.

Despite rolling out a decade ago, Rainbow Six Siege , now known as Rainbow Six Siege X , is showing little to no signs of slowing down. Leveraging its regular content updates and strategically timed free-to-play periods, the tactical FPS has also maintained a reasonable level of player interest throughout its run. In June 2025, Rainbow Six Siege X breached the 140K mark in terms of concurrent players on Steam, thanks to its second seasonal update of the year and its big 10-year anniversary makeover. Now, the devs have kicked off yet another season of the online shooter to reinvigorate player engagement.

On September 2, Ubisoft shipped Rainbow Six Siege X 's latest season, Operation High Stakes, across all platforms. This update was headlined by the inclusion of Denari, a new Defender type operator. Alongside his arrival, the T.R.I.P. Connector ability, which lets the player set up lasers that injure enemies upon detection, also became available. The Dual Front mode, which was introduced with Rainbow Six Siege X 's launch, now also offers players a new assignment called Keres Safe Room, which requires teams to successfully complete data extraction in a locked-down server room. Moreover, the new update brings certain upgrades for the Consulate, Lair, and Nighthaven maps, incorporating Destructible Ingredients into them and improving aspects such as lighting, textures, and materials.

Apart from the aforementioned additions, a number of balancing changes have also made their way to Rainbow Six Siege X . First off, Blackbeard's versatility and area-denial capabilities, in particular with frag grenades, have been nerfed. Notably, this Attacker type operator can no longer aim down sights or break undamaged barricades in certain rappelling scenarios. On the other hand, there are new loadout additions for certain Rainbow Six Siege X operators, such as Wamai, who now has the Super Shorty in his loadout. While the Reaper MK2 has been given a recoil buff, other changes have made throwing projectiles from behind the Ballistic Shield riskier for players.

Following Rainbow Six Siege X 's impressive launch performance, the devs surely hope its newly released season will keep the momentum going forward. Given that the Operation High Stakes update is also one of the first content drops for the revamped game, it could prove to be crucial towards building the foundation for Ubisoft's long-term plan for the Rainbow Six franchise.

Rainbow Six Siege X Year 10 Season 3 Patch Notes

Find the updates and fixes made over the course of the Y10S1 Season Test Server. Check out the full Operation High Stakes Patch Notes here.

BUG FIXES

GAMEPLAY

FIXED - Player collects points twice when deploying Azami's Kiba Barrier.

FIXED - The check mark indicating the respawn prompt doesn't update correctly.

FIXED - Refined trigger zone at Assembly Tank to block defuser placement via lag switch exploit. Players can still enter the tank, but planting is no longer possible.

FIXED - Idle kick fails to trigger when switching from mouse and keyboard to controller input while using Observation Tools.

FIXED - The iron sight on Denari's Glaive-12 is zoomed in while aiming down sights.

FIXED - The epilepsy tool reports Spatial Pattern Caution while watching the 1F CC Stairs on Nighthaven Labs map.

FIXED - Progress bar for Solis's overclock ability isn't refilling and shows incorrect ammo count.

FIXED - Rauora's D.O.M. Panel doesn't auto-destroy upon changing Operators.

FIXED - Shields don't transition properly when switching from aiming down sights to equipping or throwing a grenade in first-person view.

FIXED - AI Operators can get stuck in rappel.

FIXED - Level of detail issue with the red tape at the end of Fuze's Cluster Charge device.

FIXED - Shield deploy icon is present during the barricade deployment animation.

FIXED - AI Operators become inactive when they can't find a spot to camp for enemies.

FIXED - AI Operators gets stuck on a vaultable object located next to the hatch on the exterior Café Rooftop, above the 3F Cigar Balcony, on the Kafe Dostoyevsky map.

FIXED - After triggering Lesion's GU Mine, the bot turns to face the mine's last point of interest.

FIXED - AI Operators become stuck after being revived from Frost's Welcome Mat.

FIXED - Very bright light bleeds are present in basement floor on Bank map.

FIXED - The hostage doesn't cast any shadows when they're being escorted by the Attackers.

FIXED - Alibi's Prisma doesn't open when deployed at 2F CCTV Room on Club House map.

FIXED - Alibi's Prisma doesn't open when deployed at 2F Gym and 2F Bedroom on Club House map.

FIXED - AI Operators use of throwable gadgets can miss their target by a wide margin.

FIXED - Operators with sticky devices can force crash a match by deploying the device at the same time as Bandit's Shock Wire.

FIXED - Black textureless objects obstructs drone vision when passing through the vent at EXT Garage Ramp on Bank map.

FIXED - Denari's T.R.I.P. Connector can be seen floating when entering Denari's Customization tab.

FIXED - Old studs are still visible in the ceiling panels above the line of scrimmage area in Kafe Dostoyevsky map.

FIXED - Playlists become unresponsive when sixth member leaves the Squad.

LEVEL DESIGN

FIXED - Exterior is overexposed when viewed from inside.

FIXED - Non-destructible walls DAB Core walls are overlapping with most of the blocked windows on the third floor level on Kafe Dostoyevsky map.

OPERATORS

FIXED - Glaive-12 aim down sights timing was incorrect.

USER EXPERIENCE

FIXED - The Quit Matchmaking button from the Dynamic Play Button no longer displays a door icon.

FIXED - Players are able to see shadows through some solid objects.

FIXED - Cannot open pause menu in repick menu with controllers.

FIXED - Players can't scroll down in the Latest section of the Locker when hovering over an Operator Portrait or Card Background.

FIXED - Defenders affected by Grim's Kawan Hive don't see Kawan bot VFX on screen.

FIXED - Data for championship stage isn't displaying when including multiple groups in the Esports section.

FIXED - The final leaderboard can't be fully scrolled on the overview section when players select a completed championship stage in the Esports section.

FIXED - Navigation stops working when pressing right and not selecting a tile while in the Esports championship section.

FIXED - Attacker loses control of their drone when another player spectates it during the Preparation Phase.

AUDIO

FIXED - Melee SFX missing when doing a melee strike.

item.title: Roblox: Pop Starz Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Pop Starz combines the fun of dressing up with roleplay simulators. In addition to climbing the fame ladder, you can also explore the world and work at different jobs to earn money for new clothes and accessories. Luckily, there is a faster way to earn extra money, namely, using Pop Starz codes.

These Roblox codes will reward you with various rewards, including Cash. Moreover, some of them grant players valuable Gems. But it is worth noting that they have a limited validity period.

Updated September 3, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Pop Starz has a single new code you can redeem right now for some extra Gems. Using it gives you 20 Gems, which can be handy for progressing in the game. Since there’s only one active code at the moment, you’ll want to grab it before it expires. Keep checking back to see if more codes get added soon.

All Pop Starz Codes

Working Pop Starz Codes

  • POPSTARZ - Redeem this code to get 20 Gems (NEW)

Expired Pop Starz Codes

  • FIRSTCODE - Redeem this code to get 20 Gems
  • UPDATE3 - Redeem this code to get 200 Cash

Even though you spawn right away on the red carpet in Pop Starz , you have a long way to go to become a famous star. At the first stages, the main problem for players is the lack of money to buy items for creating unique looks. To fix this, you can go to one of the jobs, such as cooking pizza or sorting the library. But this is quite a long way, since you will not be paid much. If you want to instantly earn a few hundred bundles of Cash, then Pop Starz is just what you need.

These Roblox codes are a great source of free money, as they can contain up to $200 Cash, as well as other rewards. Therefore, you should not miss them, especially if you want to progress quickly.

How to Redeem Pop Starz Codes

To redeem codes in Pop Starz , players only need to make a few clicks. This feature works as simply as in most other Roblox experiences. In addition, it is available from the first minutes of the game:

  • First, launch Pop Starz .
  • Then, complete the tutorial if you haven't done so already. This will take a few minutes.
  • After that, click on the Codes button on the right side of the screen.
  • Next, enter the code and click the Redeem button to get the rewards.

How to Get More Pop Starz Codes

Since Pop Starz codes expire a while after release, you will want to use them as soon as possible. For this, we recommend you bookmark this guide. We will update it as soon as the developers add new free goodies. Alternatively, you can visit the official social media pages of the game:

  • Red Carpet Atelier Roblox group
  • Pop Starz Discord server
  • Pop Starz X page
Roblox
434
8.8 /10
Released
September 1, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen
Platform(s)
PC, iOS, Xbox One, PS4
Powered by

item.title: Roblox: Rider World Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Rider World is a large-scale Roblox game where you can test your skills and reactions in exciting fights. The game features a huge open world, so you will always find bad guys to punish and earn some money at the same time. In addition, it has many quests with interesting storylines and incredibly beautiful surroundings that are fun to explore.

But as in many other Roblox games, it is quite difficult to progress without spending Robux. Fortunately, developers often add the ability to redeem codes and get cool rewards. You can find a list of working Rider World codes in this guide.

Updated September 3, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Rider World has just been updated with 14 new codes, most of which give you Dimension Fragments to collect. These rewards can be redeemed right away and will help you stock up on useful items. Some codes even provide multiple Dimension Fragments or special extras like Summer's Amber. Make sure to use them while they last and check back for more codes in the future.

All Rider World Codes

Working Rider World Codes

  • guiportako - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • aqiuyt - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • tanx - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • breakkun - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • elfnin - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • mikanbox - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • qhay - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • bluewater - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • thanight - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • catboxtv - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • KNTR - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • Miraikuroi - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • SheepTrainer - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • odin - Redeem this code to get DFs. (NEW)
  • gokaired - Redeem this code to get 4 DFs.
  • summer25 - Redeem this code to get 4 DFs.
  • war25 - Redeem this code to get Summer's Amber.

Expired Rider World Codes

  • hibiki
  • denliner
  • roadtozector
  • agito
  • v3thenext
  • momotaros
  • xmas24
  • darktraveler
  • anotherexaid

How to Redeem Codes in Rider World

Codes in Roblox games are usually easy to redeem, as developers make this feature as accessible as possible so as not to confuse players. That's why the methods for redeeming codes are usually similar in different games, and even the buttons themselves look the same. However, while experienced players know what to do, newbies may be a little confused. To help them, we have created a guide explaining how to activate codes in Rider World :

  • Launch Roblox and open Rider World .
  • Look at the upper left corner of the screen. Find and click on the gear icon to go to settings.
  • Then select the option at the very bottom, “Redeem Code.”
  • Paste the code from the list of working codes into the white text field and click the green Redeem button.

Remember, to get all the rewards, you need to redeem the codes as soon as possible before they expire.

How to Get More Rider World Codes

Developers add code redemption features to their games to encourage players to play more. However, finding Roblox codes that work is usually a difficult task, even for experienced players. To help you with this, we create code guides every day, check them, and add new ones so that you can always get rewards. Therefore, we recommend adding our guide to your browser bookmarks. If you want to get information from official Rider World sources, you can easily do so by following the links below:

  • Rider World Roblox game page
  • Rider World Roblox group
  • Rider World Discord server
  • Rider World YouTube channel
